result_list.explanation: This stage direction indicates the setting of the play, specifying that the scene takes place in the palace of the king.
This stage direction involves interaction with an object, as it describes someone taking flowers from a drawer.
result_list.stgdir: Prenant des fleurs dans le tiroir.

result_list.explanation: This describes a non-verbal interaction where one character sees another who has entered and is standing still next to them.
result_list.stgdir: Il lève les yeux et voit Mouravieff qui est entré sans qu'il l'ait entendu, et qui est debout immobile auprès de lui.

result_list.explanation: Kneeling is a general character action and does not fit other specific categories, so it is classified as action.
This involves an object interaction as it describes presenting a piece to Varade.
Handing over a quill is an interaction with an object, thus classified under object.
It involves the narration of a sound event, as a noise of weapons is heard.
This indicates the recipient of speech, therefore it falls under the 'toward' category.
This describes a non-verbal interaction where a character takes the hands of others while addressing someone else.
result_list.stgdir: Elle prend les mains de Clarice et du Chevalier, en disant à la Dame :

result_list.explanation: Giving a promise is considered an interaction involving an object, even though it's metaphorical.
result_list.stgdir: Il lui donne la promesse de Cléandre.
